p: We observed that DENV and CHIKV studies were primarily conducted during and after the year 2004, when CHIKV re-emerged in Kenya and spread rapidly though new areas. Two studies were conducted in Kenya [ 144, 144] and one in Cameroon [ 147] before the CHIKV outbreak in 2004, but these studies focused on several arboviruses affecting those two countries, including CHIKV, yellow fever virus (YFV), tick-borne encephalitis virus, DENV, sindbis virus, oâ€™nyong nyong virus and Tahyna virus.
